intro: Stichorkis chlorantha, commonly known as the green stichorkis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought. The species is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
